timeline.bodyText: How about renaming this to the more general FIELD_ID since it is not really secrets specific anyway and might be used for other entities as well. WDYT?
timeline.author: sophokles73

replies.bodyText: Why not. I updated the description so it doesn't lower the code readability.
replies.author: jbtrystram

timeline.bodyText: what is the uniqueness scope of this ID? I assume it is just the containing Credentials instance, right? However, IMHO we should document this here.
timeline.author: sophokles73

replies.bodyText: Can these IDs be assigned by a client, i.e. when registering the credentials? If so, do we check that the IDs are unique within the credentials?
replies.author: sophokles73

timeline.bodyText: you shouldn't complete the context for each secret ...

timeline.bodyText: there is not much left to compare, is there?
timeline.author: sophokles73

replies.bodyText: the credential type, auth-id and all the credential-level fields are still there
